meanings.definition: To separate or purify by washing or rinsing.
meanings.sent1: I will elutriate the rice to remove any dirt before cooking it.
meanings.sent2: She decided to elutriate the vegetables before preparing the salad.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he needed to elutriate the kitchen after a messy cooking session.
meanings.sent4: The gentle rain seemed to elutriate the worries from her mind.
meanings.sent5: The clear stream elutriated the pebbles, leaving them sparkling in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To remove fine particles by washing or rinsing.
meanings.sent1: After the hike, I had to elutriate the mud from my shoes.
meanings.sent2: The laundry detergent was effective in elutriating the stains from the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The car wash machine can elutriate even the tiniest specks of dirt.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to elutriate the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The gentle waves elutriated the sand, revealing hidden treasures beneath.

meanings.definition: To purify or separate by sedimentation.
meanings.sent1: The settling tank will elutriate the impurities from the water.
meanings.sent2: The process of elutriating the mixture will yield a clear solution.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could elutriate the good luck from a rabbit's foot.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to elutriate the negativity from the situation.
meanings.sent5: The slow rotation of the centrifuge elutriated the different components of the liquid.
